rules: Rule1: If the artist utilizes alcohol, then the artwork is successful.
Rule2: Under the condition that the animal depicts a natural habitat, the animal is approved for the artwork.

Rule3: If insurance holds for the artwork, then whenever it is not the case that either the artwork violates regulations or, if the artwork features the animal, then the animal depicts a natural habitat, legal action does not occur.
Rule4: If the artist utilizes technology, then the artwork is successful.
Rule5: Whenever the gallery exhibits the artwork, the gallery receives funding.
Rule6: Either the gallery exhibits the artwork or the patron sponsors the artwork.
Rule7: Provided that the patron sponsors the artwork, then if the artist creates the artwork, either the artist utilizes alcohol or the artist utilizes technology.
Rule8: If the audience attracts the artwork, then whenever the artist creates the artwork, either the artist utilizes alcohol or the artist utilizes technology.
Rule9: Under the condition that the artwork generates revenue, the audience attracts the artwork.
Rule10: If the gallery receives funding, then the artwork generates revenue.
Rule11: Whenever it is not the case that either the artist utilizes alcohol or the artist utilizes technology, a backup plan exists.
Rule12: If it is not the case that either the artwork violates regulations or, if the artwork features the animal, then the animal depicts a natural habitat, legal action occurs.

Rule13: Provided that it is not the case that if it is not the case that either the artist utilizes alcohol or the artist utilizes technology, then a backup plan does not exist, the artwork features the animal.

Rule14: If it is not the case that if it is not the case that either the artist utilizes alcohol or the artist utilizes technology, then a backup plan does not exist, the animal is not approved for the artwork.
Rule15: Under the condition that insurance does not hold for the artwork, the artist faces bankruptcy.
facts: Fact1: The artist creates the artwork.
Fact2: It is not the case that the artwork violates regulations.
Fact3: It is not the case that the artist faces bankruptcy.
